item.title: Signaling for Call Centers
item.description:
Every phone call involves two parts: the conversation itself and the signaling that manages the phone network. While signaling might seem purely technical, its implementation significantly impacts call center efficiency. Traditional analog phone lines use the same copper wires, called the local loop, for both voice and signaling. Touchtone dialing, handset lifting, and ringing all rely on electrical signals sent over this shared connection. This method, known as in-band signaling, has limitations...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/signaling-for-call-centers/
